climbs.name: Twisted Sister
climbs.fa: Jim McConachie,Alan Nilsson,Brad Young,Robert Behrens, Josh Mucci

content.description:
Four mild bulges are each protected by a bolt.  The climbing gets easier as you go.  Past the 5th bolt the climbing turns to 5.0 for the last 50 ft to the top.

This route was established after the publishing of Brad Young's excellent 2007 guidebook.  To check out more new routes at Pinnacle visit the Mud and Crud website.

mudncrud.com/forums/index.p…
content.location: Located to the right of the center route on the first sister.  Look for a new bolt about 15 feet up.

content.description: Thought this was the most fun route on the 1st sister.  Heads up to the left side and follows underneath a big seam. Can get a little pro before the first bolt.
content.protection:
Can sling a nob and place a nut on the way to the first bolt.

Three bolts total. Finishes same anchors as Left Route.
content.location:
Left of the Left Route. We started a little up the slope on the left side up some steep, large knobs.

Descent: two raps to the ground with a single 60.

content.description: This popular route can be done two ways. Either start on "The Left Route" and traverse up and right past bolts or climb directly up from below (run-out 5.3). Rappel off.
content.protection: Two protection bolts and a two-bolt anchor which allows a single rope rappel from the top.  Two extra bolts for the alternate start just right of the big pillar.

content.description: This fun route climbs up the left-center of the face.
content.protection: Four protection bolts and a mid-climb two bolt anchor which allows for a single rope rappel.
